Article.ArticleTitle: Modeling of spatial and temporal variations of ozone-NO<sub>x</sub>-VOC sensitivity based on photochemical indicators in China.

AbstractText: Comprehensive air quality model with extensions (CAMx)-decoupled direct method (DDM) was used to simulate ozone-NO<sub>x</sub>-VOCs sensitivity of for May-November in 2016-2018 in China. Based on the relationship between the simulated ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) sensitivity values and the ratio of formaldehyde (HCHO) to NO<sub>2</sub> (FNR) and the ratio of production rate of hydrogen peroxide (H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub>) to production rate of nitric acid (HNO<sub>3</sub>) ( [Formula: see text] ), the localized range of FNR and [Formula: see text] thresholds in different regions in China were obtained. The overall simulated FNR values are about 1.640-2.520, and [Formula: see text] values are about 0.540-0.830 for the transition regime. Model simulated O<sub>3</sub> sensitivities or region specific FNR or [Formula: see text] thresholds should be applied to ensure the accurate local O<sub>3</sub> sensitivity regimes. Using the tropospheric column FNR values from ozone monitoring instrument (OMI) satellite data as an indicator with the simulated threshold values, the spatial distributions of O<sub>3</sub> formation regimes in China are determined. The O<sub>3</sub> sensitivity regimes from eastern to central China are gradually from VOC-limited, transition to NO<sub>x</sub>-limited spatially, and moving toward to transition or NO<sub>x</sub>-limited regime from 2005 to 2019 temporally.
